snippet: Daw Aung San Suu Kyi called for a “good relationship” with the military and vowed to infuse new blood into the party, which is recovering from more than two decades of persecution under military rule.
abstract: Myanmar's main opposition party ends two-day congress with party's leader, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, calling for 'good relationship' with the military; vows to infuse new blood into the party, which is recovering from more than two decades of persecution under military rule.
lead_paragraph: Daw Aung San Suu Kyi called for a “good relationship” with the military and vowed to infuse new blood into the party, which is recovering from more than two decades of persecution under military rule.

headline.seo: Daw Aung San Suu Kyi Seeks to Revitalize Myanmar Opposition Party
headline.main: Myanmar Opposition Leader Vows Party Reform
headline.print_headline: Myanmar Opposition Leader Vows Party Reform
